item.description:
Holiday Open House
Saturday, December 4, 2010
10:00 a.m.-4:00 p.m.
FREE Admission

This special day at the Millyard Museum includes a full schedule of events. Take in some affordable
holiday shopping in the Museum Shop and meet local authors as they unveil new books
on the history of fire fighting in Manchester, and on Franco-American history and culture. Plus, see a new temporary exhibit in the State Theatre Gallery!

Manchester’s annual Christmas Parade starts at 4 p.m. Park in the Millyard and walk up to Elm Street after the Holiday Open House!

Schedule for the Holiday Open House:

Opening of the new temporary exhibit: “Lisa Fletcher – Botanical Watercolors 1892” in the State Theatre Gallery

10: 30 a.m. – Guided Tour of the Millyard Museum

10 a.m. – 3:30 p.m. Book signings and Meet the Authors

-- Robert B. Perreault, author of the new book “Franco-American Life & Culture in Manchester New Hampshire – Vivre la Différence"

-- Steve Pearson, author of the new book “Manchester Firefighting – A Pictorial History”

Plus short author’s presentations:
1 p.m.-Robert B. Perreault
2 p.m.-Steve Pearson

Free Raffles - win a $100 gift certificate from Bellman’s Jewelers or a private tour of the Currier Museum of Art for your family or group, and more!

Cookies and cider

Play old-fashioned board games and win free prizes by completing an educational Gallery Hunt

Holiday Shopping in the Museum Shop featuring the new brass ornament: “Amoskeag Manufacturing Company Mill Girl”

Members of the Manchester Historic Association will receive an EXTRA 10% discount on purchases made at the Holiday Open House!
item.name: Holiday Open House
